stories.text:
I use orgmode to track my side projects and really happy with it. I cringe each time I need to deal with corporate jira afterwards. The easiness of tossing and reorganizing, I miss it badly while doing something like planning, backlog grooming.

While I understand that orgmode has some scalability problems and definitely cannot be used for big projects, even if we pretend that there are no problems adopting it for all project members. I'm still curious about using it in small projects. Is there anybody who tried that? What do you think?
stories.title: Ask HN: Orgmode for Bug/Project Tracking

stories.text:
Is there any company out there, making a no code smart contracts builder for Ethereum, or Solana ?

I'm curious to know what's been your experience with using a no code tool for web3, if any, and if it was any good at helping you build an NFT or DeFi product faster/better?

My thinking is that no code is still quite nascent in web2, so there would be less of it in Web3, but I haven't searched around or tested this out. Who's making No code developer tools for Web3 and blockchain smart contracts? — Would you be interested in a No code Dapp, or smart contract builder for Web 3?
stories.title: Ask HN: Would developers use a No code Dapp or smart contract builder for Web 3?
